body.p: Both boards concluded that the pooling method is so fundamentally flawed that it does not warrant retention, regardless of perceived problems with the acquisition method. The boards also observed that the most frequently cited concern is remedied by the requirement of IAS 36 Impairment of Assets and FASB Statement No. 142 Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets (SFAS 142) to test goodwill for impairment and recognise a loss if it is impaired rather than to amortise goodwill.
